intro: Urostigma subpanduriforme, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Urostigma subpanduriforme is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is a hardy perennial in its native range.
